page.description: Get the sequence number of the named argument. Returns -1 if not found.
page.original:
SQL::Arguments::ArgumentNumber() Syntax Sequence_Number as N = .ArgumentNumber( Name as C ) ArgumentDescription Sequence_NumberThe sequence number of an argument. A SQL::Arguments object. NameThe unique name property of a SQL::Argument object set with the SQL::Arguments::Add() or SQL::Arguments::Set() methods.
Description The ArgumentNumber() method returns the sequence number (subscript) of an argument. Examples dim args as SQL::Arguments ? args.add("city", "Boston") = .T. ? args.add("state", "MA") = .T. ? args.ArgumentNumber("state") = 2
See Also SQL::Arguments Object Limitations
